20110125022915.000|20110125022917.000|CC1|EVERYONE.                       
20110125022917.000|20110125022918.000|CC1|IN MOSCOW TODAY, THE SUICIDE    
20110125022918.000|20110125022919.000|CC1|BOMBER HAD ONE THING IN MINT: TO
20110125022919.000|20110125022920.000|CC1|KILL OR MAIM AS MANY PEOPLE AS  
20110125022920.000|20110125022922.000|CC1|POSSIBLE AT RUSSIA'S BIGGEST    
20110125022922.000|20110125022923.000|CC1|AIRPORT WITH A BOMB HIDDEN IN A 
20110125022923.000|20110125022924.000|CC1|SUITCASE.                       
20110125022924.000|20110125022925.000|CC1|THE EXPLOSION KILLED AT LEAST 35
20110125022925.000|20110125022928.000|CC1|AND WOUNDED 180.                
20110125022928.000|20110125022930.000|CC1|NO GROUP HAS CLAIMED            
20110125022930.000|20110125022931.000|CC1|RESPONSIBILITY, BUT ISLAMIC     
20110125022931.000|20110125022933.000|CC1|INSURGENTS ARE SUSPECTED.       
20110125022933.000|20110125022934.000|CC1|THE BOMBER TARGETED THE         
20110125022934.000|20110125022936.000|CC1|INTERNATIONAL ARRIVALS TERMINAL 
20110125022936.000|20110125022937.000|CC1|JUST OUTSIDE THE SECURITY ZONE, 
20110125022937.000|20110125022941.000|CC1|AN AREA WITH FEW GUARDS BUT LOTS
20110125022941.000|20110125022943.000|CC1|OF PASSENGERS AND THEIR         
20110125022943.000|20110125022944.000|CC1|FAMILIES.                       
20110125022944.000|20110125022946.000|CC1|MARK PHILLIPS REPORTS THEY      
20110125022946.000|20110125022947.000|CC1|BECAME VICTIMS IN AN INSTANT.   
20110125022947.000|20110125022948.000|CC1|>> Reporter: MOSCOW'S BUSIEST   
20110125022948.000|20110125022950.000|CC1|AIRPORT IN THE LATE AFTERNOON   
20110125022950.000|20110125022952.000|CC1|RUSH AS MANY INTERNATIONAL      
20110125022952.000|20110125022953.000|CC1|FLIGHTS WERE ARRIVING.          
20110125022953.000|20110125022955.000|CC1|A BOMB CARRIED, RUSSIAN         
20110125022955.000|20110125022956.000|CC1|OFFICIALS SAY, BY A SUICIDE     
20110125022956.000|20110125022958.000|CC1|BOMBER GOES OFF.

20110125023025.000|20110125023029.000|CC1|SAME AIRPORT IN 2004.
